sense.name: Pinc, squeeze, or pull (out) sharply.
sense.examples: Don't tweak my nipples! Tweak the dead flowers off the bush. Puppies don't like it when you tweak their ears.

sense.name: Adjust finely to increase or decrease something.
sense.commentary: Includes: TWEAK UP, TWEAK OUT, TWEAK DOWN
sense.examples: He tweaked up the flavor in his Jambalaya. Tweak the engine just right and it purrs like a kitten. God, he tweaked out that bike - it's amazing! We need to tweak down our level of police response.

sense.name: (Cause to) seize or act as if seizing, possibly due to drugs.
sense.examples: John tweaked out and lost control of his body when the strobe lights came on. I tweaked out last night on meth. Most people tweak across the road when they see a big man like myself coming down the sidewalk. Dealers tweak out teenagers without concern for their futures.

sense.name: TWEAK ACROSS: port an idea, possibly in the form of a computer program or script, across various domains.
sense.examples: It tweaked across several platforms really easily. We tweaked the script across all of out pages. The band tweaks across the spectrum of urban music.

sense.name: Move quickly in front of or around, as to entice.
sense.examples: Trout will attack most anything you tweak across their noses. We tweaked the lure in front of a large fish. Just tweak the offer in front of the board and see if they take it.
